dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Your mom’s giving music lessons?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Just that kid, her brother Josh was killed. Remember? In the car crash, the day we went to Fenway?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Was that the same day, I don’t think so. Did you know that kid?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I saw him around. He was a bit of a dweeb, but nice. You know his dad?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m doing some legal work for him. He didn’t mention that to you, talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Like what dad?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter. Let’s get a pie and some snacks for the game. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Have you got money?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Your mom say I’m broke or something?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I thought you left your wallet?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I’ve some extra cash. I‘1l get the wallet tomorrow. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 110 Dwight and Lucas are on the edge of their seats. The Sox are ahead 10-3. It’s a thrilling game. The Yankees ground out - the Sox are in the Series! Lucas hugs his dad, jumps with joy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Oh my God, dad, you think this is the year they win the Series?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Remember you can always trust the Sox to break your heart.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No, dad, no. This is it. (a beat) You're the best, dad. INT. LEARNER HOUSE. ETHAN’S STUDY - NIGHT 99 Grace is on Ethan’s home computer. As she hits the space bar: ON THE SCREEN: a private detective web site. She clicks on the screen and another investigative screen appears. She clicks again, another, and another, and another.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Ethan is back from college, (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (slightly guilty) I was just looking at some of this stuff. Ethan joins her, looks at the page on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: That’s a group who accumulate information about repeat offenders, drunk drivers, lenient judges. She clicks again. A site on diplomats who have committed crimes while covered by diplomatic immunity.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, diplomats can just walk away from a crime, often the state department wants to cover it up. There are a lot of them up here. She clicks again. A Net Detective Agency.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, let me show you. He ushers her up from the office chair clicks on another site.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m looking into other possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What sort of possibilities?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Of how to find this guy.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I thought we had lawyers doing this for us. I’m worried about you Ethan. You seem to be lost in this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I’ve got to find him, Grace. I’m going to find him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Which “him” are you talking about, Ethan? Not our son. How are you going to find him?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: How can you say that. I can’t believe that I have to defend myself to you as well.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: As well, as well as who?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Everyone I talk to says you have to move on, put it behind you, let the police take care of it. Why? Why do they say that?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Because they want to see you heal.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No they want to see me resign myself to the fact that this guy who destroyed our lives will get away with it. Why should he get away with it?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t want him to get away with it but he can’t suck the life out of us as well. It’s going to take everything we have - everything - for this family just to survive. You were always there for us Ethan, please don’t abandon us now. He hears what she says, takes it in. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. BEDROOM - DAY 111 Sunday morning. Dwight, in his boxers, on the bed staring at the ceiling. Lucas comes in, decked out in Red Sox gear.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: How about you pitch me a few?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll be right out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dwight gets up, pulls on sweats, rummages for a T-shirt but hears something, listens closer, A LOW MECHANICAL RUMBLE. Panic, as Dwight bursts from the room. EXT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE - DAY 112 Dwight rushes out and discovers Lucas staring into the garage at the Ford Explorer as the garage door rumbles open. Lucas sees the fear in Dwight’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What’s wrong Dad? Dwight stops.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I’m getting the net out. Dwight calms down.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Dwight stares at the Explorer. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. GARAGE - DAY 113 Lucas squeezes by the Explorer to get to the net frame at the back of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You're keeping the truck?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: No, no, I’m waiting for the junk people to come and get it. Lucas reaches the net frame at the back of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You’1l have to move the truck, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Let's forget the net. I/’11 just pitch. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Ah Dad, we’ll have to run after all the balls.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED. 114
dialogues.text: INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM - DAY 115 Sunday afternoon. ESPN baseball round up on TV. Lucas is glued to every word. Dwight’s enjoying his company.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTSCASTER
dialogues.text: So is this the Red Sox year? Will we see the end of the curse of the bambino? Lucas nudges his dad.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Told you.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTSCASTER
dialogues.text: Let’s look at last week’s play. The doorbell rings. Dwight gets up. Checks through the blinds, sees a STATE TROOPER CAR in the driveway. Dwight opens the door and greets TWO STATE TROOPERS.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: Mr. Wheldon?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: Do you own a 1998 Ford Explorer?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I did. why?

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: You don’t have it anymore?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Why, what’s this about?

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: Routine investigation. We’re checking on those types of vehicles. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: State records show you are the owner of 1998 explorer CUR 560H. Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: The transmission went. I donated it to one of those charities, a Cancer thing. They towed it away. I’m still waiting for the receipt.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad ... Lucas appears at the living room door behind stops talking when he sees the state trooper.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I’1l be back in a second. Lucas studies the state trooper.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hi. The state trooper smiles, nods.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: You turn the plates in yet? Lucas turns, heads back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: No I haven't. I took them in to work and forgot to have them mailed back.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: Better mail them in, and when you get that receipt ... (hands card) ... drop off a copy. I need to account for it.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Sure officer. Dwight but The state trooper turns, walks away, sees the rental car, turns back to Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: This your new car? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: It’s a rental, until I decide what to buy next. The state trooper points to the rental, which is splattered with bird droppings from the overhanging tree.

dialogues.speaker: STATE TROOPER
dialogues.text: Better move it into the garage. That bird shit will corrode the finish.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Thanks. EXT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE - DAY 116 The trooper sits in his cruiser, writing notes, as Dwight goes back inside. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE LIVING ROOM - DAY 117 Lucas is engrossed in the TV.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Are you in trouble, dad?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: No, a form I didn’t fill out, that’s all. Dwight goes to the blinds, eases them back. The state trooper is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan pulls up and discovers RAUL’S TRUCK parked in the driveway. Alongside the usual lawnmowers and leaf blowers is Josh’s bicycle. ONE OF RAUL’S WORKERS emerges carrying roller blades, another has an aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? The Mexican laborers clearly don’t speak English. They look at him puzzled.  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace has all of Josh’s possessions, clothes, games, equipment, stacked on the picnic table, and is handing piles to Raul and his workers. Ethan bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Raul, take the rest of these.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Raul, take them and go.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Have I no say in this?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No you don’t Ethan. Unless there’s some advice, some wonderful remedy on the internet as to how to dispose of your dead son’s possessions. Or do they recommend keeping them in order to nurture your anger.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Don’t fucking talk to me like that. I want to heal as much as you do, but I will never get it while his murderer is out there. Don’t you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No I don’t. All I understand is that my son is not coming home. He’s not coming home.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No. I won’t go through my life hiding from the fact I never did anything to right that wrong. She turns into the house yelling back. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Now we have a daughter to raise and if you can’t understand that you can get out! She slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside tables at a downtown restaurant, filled with the regular LUNCHTIME MIX OF LOCALS. Dwight and Steve sit over the remains of lunch. CHERYL, the cute, the waitress, bangs two orders of pie down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CHERYL
dialogues.text: Who’s got the coconut cream?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: (leering) The nut’s mine, Cheryl honey. The cream, too.

dialogues.speaker: CHERYL
dialogues.text: I don’t get paid enough to be your honey, Steve. Cream or no cream.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: We can negotiate. Cheryl walks off, Steve watching her ass all the way.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, my fucking kingdom for a waitress. You getting much these days?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I’m not getting any. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Come on, good looking guy, divorced, party animal. You must be knocking them down two by two.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Party animal? I go to Pizza Hut once a week with Lucas. That’s my idea of a party.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Jeez, that’s depressing. I figured you come in looking like shit, you musta been banging all night. Now you’re telling me ...

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I come in looking like shit?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Check the mirror. You're letting it slide buddy.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: What’s this about?

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: You haven’t done a thing in over a month. Nora Fennelli’s threatening to find another firm.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: She doesn’t know what she wants. One minute it’s ...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Forget it Dwight, you’ve always got somebody else to blame. It’s about running a business. I took a gamble hiring you.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Gamble? Harvard Law school. Boston’s best law firm.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, how about drunk and disorderly, and an order of protection against you? A child with two teeth knocked out? Dwight’s trigger temper takes over, his eyes are on fire, his whole demeanor is attack. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Go ahead Steve, take Ruth’s side now...

dialogues.speaker: STEVE
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself, everybody's against you. I’m all you’ve got Dwight. I’ve gone to court for you. I gave you a job when no one would hire you. I’ve been taking your side for years and, still, you won’t listen to me. I’m gonna say it one last time, you wipe your own shit or you lie in it. Steve gets up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You get the check, I pay you enough.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: PARENTS and CHILDREN mill around. Above a folding table with school printed programs. A SIGN announces “SCHOOL CONCERT - 7:00 PM. ADMISSION FREE.” CLOSE on Ethan, head down, forging through, as Grace acknowledges nod, smiles. Ethan is on ahead now - a distance between them.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rows of folding chairs. At the front a piano, a piano stool, and music stand occupy a low makeshift stage. As people take their seats. Ruth Wheldon adjusts the height of the music stand.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CONCERT HALL. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A student quartet is playing.  124 125 76. INT. DWIGHT’S CAR - CONTINUOUS 124 Dwight in his car in the crowded school parking lot. The sound drifts out of the building. He opens the glove box and pulls out a pint of Jack Daniels, takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The performer finishes playing the song. APPLAUSE. From the back of the gym, the faint GROAN of hinges. A couple of heads turn to glare at the latecomer. DWIGHT eases the door closed. He decides to stand against the back wall, in the shadows. Ruth steps back up to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: The next performer will be Emma Learner who will play her own compostion. APPLAUSE. Emma emerges from stage right. Dwight stares.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: This is for my brother Josh. Deathly silence in the hall. Emma begins to play. She misses an occasional note, but soldiers on. Ruth stands close by, ready for whatever support Emma might need, but the child makes it through the piece. Rapturous APPLAUSE. The audience stands and claps. Ethan hugs Grace close, helps her dry her tears. He is close again, holding, bridging the gap that has grown through recent days. The fear, recriminations, self doubt have been driven away by Emma’s simple tune of love. At the back of the hall, Dwight is still as stone, as though he were a statue fixed to the wall. The Ruth Wheldon wanders out on stage. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtai: two podium: 77.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: This school prides itself on the wit and outstanding intelligence of its pupils and to demonstrate we present our battle of the brains, between Lucas Arno of the sixth grade and Gerry Edelstein of the seventh grade. n pulls back to reveal a game show backdrop and iS, Lucas behind one, GERRY behind the other.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Each contestant will ask a question of the other. The contestant with the most correct answers wins. Gerry Edelstein will go first.

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: If a turtle looses it shell is it homeless or naked?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Both.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Can vegetarians eat animal crackers?

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: Why did kamikaze pilots wear helmets?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Pass. If a man speaks in the middle of the forest and there’s no woman to hear him, is he still wrong?

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: If a deaf person swears, does his mother wash his hands with soap.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Yes. The audience is in stitches. Ethan and Grace are laughing through their tears. At the back of the hall, Dwight is also in tears, laughing but there’s a madness to his laugh, a terrible lost desperation.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you get if you cross poison ivy with four leaf clover.

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: A rash of good luck.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: If a cow laughs does milk come out its nose?

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: Pass. Two part question. What do you call a deer with no eyes?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No ideer.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: What do you call a deer with no eyes and no legs?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Still no ideer.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Correct. Last round. You can choose. Movies and politics. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Movies. If Superman can stop bullets with his chest, why does he always duck when someone throws a gun at him?

dialogues.speaker: GERRY EDELSTEIN
dialogues.text: No idea. Politics. If con is the opposite of pro, then what is the opposite of progress. Lucas waves his arms to the audience. The all shout.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Congress.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, it’s a draw. Huge applause. Lucas and Gerry bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concert over, Ethan, Grace (holding hands, close) and Emma work their way through the CROWD OF HAPPY PARENTS. Everyone offers congratulations to Emma. There’s a great buzz following the finale skit. Ethan, has his arm around Grace as they move toward their car. Another PARENT stops them.

dialogues.speaker: PARENT
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you Emma. What an inspiration. I wanted to come by your house at the time but ... As they talk Ethan hears someone calling, a distinctive voice, a terrible echo of that night.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Lou. He breaks away as Grace talks with the parent. Now he’s almost trembling, his eyes search the car park. He moves further among the tangle of cars and parents. His eyes search around, he’s panicked, maybe he’s hearing noises. Across the car park, he sees Lucas, taking high fives and congrats from people. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then, from behind, Lucas he hears the voice again.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lou! Hey Lou. He looks back beyond Lucas who has turned around, and sees Dwight, hurrying through the crowd. Lucas walks toward Dwight, who picks his son up and twirls him around. Ethan is frozen to the spot. Then a tap on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: What is it? Ethan turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Grace finds Emma, kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh sweetie that was so beautiful. She looks around for Ethan, sees that he has wandered further away.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ethan, where are you going? He returns.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s up.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Nothing’s wrong. I can’t stand all this sympathy. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hey, our composer’s here. Ethan bends down to Emma, but keeps looking in Dwight’s direction. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: You were marvellous. They get in the car and begin to drive, and, as they pass, Ethan watches as Dwight with his arm proudly around Lucas meets up with Ruth and Norris. Ethan’s car cruises past unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Was he the greatest or what? Norris ruffles Lucas hair. Dwight holds on to his son, possessively.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: See, you remembered every line.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (to Dwight) Norris practiced with him every night.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah, great. INT. LEARNER HOUSE. JOSH’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Ethan sits on the floor by Josh’s bed, his eyes a million miles away. Grace comes in. in bed with Grace. He lies on his back staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here Ethan? He doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please Ethan, let’s get therapy. I thought tonight you had broken free, now look at you. I’ve lost you Ethan and I don’t know how to get you back.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: You've lost me! I’ve lost myself. My soul. No amount of therapy is ever going to give that back to me, don’t you understand that? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Please Ethan, you are our strength, our security ...

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, the great protector of the family. How can you say that? My son is dead ... while his father watched ...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Please, please Ethan we have got to get past this.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (quiet anger) Don’t say that to me. There’s no going past this. Grace leaves. Ethan opens his hand to reveal Dwight’s business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight jogs down the street. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. KITCHEN - EARLY MORNING 130 Dwight returns from a early morning sprint. He takes juice from the fridge, pours a glass, sits at the breakfast bar. His house phone rings. He picks it up, answers expecting a friendly voice, instead he looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Hello ... Oh, Mr. Learner. No, no, I’ve been running ... Not at all ... Ah, no, I’m free ... Sure, where? ... Where? No, but I can find it. An hour, yeah. Yeah. Dwight hangs up, looks like he has just been shot. INT. DWIGHT’S CAR - DAY 131 Dwight approaches the junction at Reservation Road. This is the first time he’s been there since the accident. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now he sees the junior league soft ball pitch and the old cemetary. And, as he turns the bend, he sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan in the forecourt of the gas station looking up at the CROWS ‘cawking’ above him Dwight’s car pulls in. He gets out. They shake hands. Ethan starts walking toward the spot where Josh died.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Dwight, thanks for taking the time. I wanted to meet here because I’ve a few ideas that might help the investigation. As they cross the gas station forecourt

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you been here before?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: No, no. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you’d come to familiarize yourself with the case.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: We're looking into hiring a private investigator. He’d do that.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Let me show you where Josh died. They reach the spot.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right here. The killer came round that bend, had to be doing fifty, swerved right over there, came back and hit my son right here. He must have been drunk? He looks to Dwight for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Well I guess there’s no way of knowing for sure? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Only the killer knows, and he’s not going to talk. Ethan starts walking back toward the crossroads. A truck comes up behind them, Dwight sees it first, grabs Ethan’s arm, pulls him off the roadway as the truck roars by.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Jesus! Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: The police have dumped this case, haven,t they?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: No, not completely. I think they have a few things going. I’m hopeful they might catch a break soon.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Gimme a few days and I might have something concrete for you. At the corner where they can see A KIDS’ SOFTBALL GAME in progress.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mr. Arno but I’m sick of waiting. Look how beautiful it is. Here’s what I’d like to do. I'd like to offer a reward, a big one. $250,000, a half a million, whatever I can borrow on the house. Get the press to come here. That would give me a chance to make an appeal, to ask this man how he can live with himself. How he could do such a cowardly thing as to drive away and leave a ten year old boy dying in the dirt? Do you think that would work?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah, that might spark something. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN.
dialogues.text: (checking watch) I got to get home. My daughter frets when I leave. (a beat) Let me ask you this, you’ve got a son, same age as Josh. If someone killed him and you found out who this guy was what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I’d turn him in.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Would you? Knowing he’ll get a slap on the wrist.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I don’t know that this is a good conversation to have with your lawyer. Ethan reaches over, shakes Dwight’s hand, holds it.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. Ethan leaves. Dwight’s hands are trembling as he watches Ethan get into his car and drives off. Dwight wanders to the crossroads, studies some kids hitting balls on the diamond, he sits on a bench. he can barely breath. Then the sound of a CAR HORN. He turns, sees ETHAN driving in the opposite direction. Ethan waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight’s rental car pulls in next to RUTH’S MINIVAN and TWO OTHER CARS in the driveway. As he walks thee path to the door, Dwight can see a GROUP OF FRIENDS gathered around the fireplace and hears CONVERSATION and LAUGHTER coming from inside the house. He KNOCKS on the door. Norris opens the door. His smile evaporates when he sees who it is. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Hey Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Norris, listen. I’d like to talk to Ruth. Can you get her for me?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: She’s kinda busy just now.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: It’s important. I wouldn’t be here otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Actually, we’re in the middle of a little shindig, a few friends.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Ruth. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Okay, Dwight, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Norris ... Ruth appears at the door beside Norris.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dwight, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Ruth, can I talk to you for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: We've got people over.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: (sardonic) Yeah a shindig.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Dwight, you want to talk to me, you can talk on Sunday like usual.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Please, I need a big favor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Norris, you better go back to our guests. Ruth steps onto the porch. It’s cold, she rubs her arms.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: You want my coat?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: The World Series starts tomorrow. Let Lou stay over with me for the week.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Please. I really need your help. Norris doesn’t care about baseball. The Sox in the Series. It might never happen again. Please. I’11 get him to school every morning. Just one week then you'll have him all the time.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I’m going away.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Away, something I’ve got to do. She studies.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dwight, you’re always running away from yourself ... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Not this time. This time I have to face up to who I am. She turns and stares out at the night.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Why should I believe you this time? I’ve heard this so many times before and I prayed it was true. Now it’s too late for us. But our son ...

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: This time I’ve no choice.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Tell me what’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Let me have the Series with my son.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Okay, Dwight. You can have him for the week. Just make sure you get him to school on time in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: You know I’m sorry. 88. She hands him his coat back, then kisses him on the mouth. And she’s gone, leaving him alone on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight and Lucas enter this amusement park.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I though we’d catch a few rides, get some of those chili cheese dogs ... 134 135 136 (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: The ones that made me puke on the roller coaster.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: That’s the ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth is cleaning up. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to Ethan and Emma are on the porch. Emma holds the flowers, Ethan has the cake.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Emma. What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: She did so well at the concert, played so beautifully, we wanted to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight and Lucas, wandering the fairground, stop at the hot dog stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan, Emma and Ruth sit around the kitchen table. The flowers are already in a vase on the table, and Ruth is opening the Black Forest cake.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Oh my God Look at all this chocolate. You have to have some Emma. Ruth gets a plate, cuts Emma a slice. RUTH (CONT’D) Mr. Learner?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Ethan. Not for me thanks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I’ve made some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I hope Emma’s going to keep up her lessons now that the concert’s over. You’re a very talented young lady.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I'd like that. Ethan sees photos of Lucas on the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Your son’s sox fan. He must be excited about the series.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: He and his dad are fanatics. He’s over at his Dwight’s place to watch the ball game.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: How long where you guys together?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Eight years. Yeah well Dwight and I used to have two nicknames for each other. Nitro and Glycerine. You mix the two and you’ve got a big explosion. But he’s devoted to Lucas. very close.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Dwight lives near by?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Yeah on Cove Road, so that he could be close to Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight clears up the food trays on a bench. . Lucas arrives, excited.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dad, you gotta check this out. Come on. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hurries Dwight over to an old-fashioned arcade machine. The head and shoulders of an old fashioned clown.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: This is old.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It’s so great, watch. Lucas drops a quarter in and the clown begins to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: laugh ... harder, and harder. And now Lucas is laughing ... and Dwight’s starting to laugh and it builds ... and people who stop are laughing as well ... all of it propelled by Lucas infectious joy. The clown finally stops. Dwight and Lucas, tears of laughter streaming down their faces, hug ... true, unconditional love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth beams as she talks about Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Tell your son I said he has a big future in comedy.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: It’s such a surprise when you discover a talent in your child.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I remember when we discovered Josh was such a beautiful cello player ...

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: (realizes) I’m truly sorry, I never meant ...

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: No, don’t be sorry. Anyway, we'd better get back to Emma’s mom. Do you mind if I use the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: No, go right ahead, it’s at the top of the stairs.  142 143 144 145 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan climbs the stairs. He looks around finds the bathroom but also sees a bedroom festooned in Red Sox paraphanalia. He stops, listens to Ruth chat with Emma, then, quietly, walks into Lucas’ room. INT. WHELDON HOUSE. LUCAS’ BEDROOM - DAY 143 Ethan takes in the room, the mess, school books, baseball glove, and on a chest of drawers, a series of photos in cheap frames. He studies this chronicle of Lucas’ life. Then one photo rivets him to the spot. CLOSE ON a photo of Dwight and Lucas in the car park of Fenway, holding Red Sox shirts, as they lean against a 1998 dark blue Ford Explorer with a grill guard. Ethan carefully picks up the photo, slides it between his belt and the small of his back, and adjusts his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth is still talking to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: I think you should compose more, we’ll do a symphony. Ethan appears.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Okay, little lady we got to go. Emma gets up, heads to the door with Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: RUTH
dialogues.text: Thank you for everything. See you soon Emma, yes?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight and Lucas leave the rollercoaster, and head past the bumper cars on their way out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: After the Series, I’ve got to go away for a while.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (distracted) Sure, dad. Hey, I got tickets left, let’s do the bumpers.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Nah, come on, we want to get home in plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Please. Lucas is already on the steps.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: You can go on, I don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: (firm) No, you go. Lucas jumps in a bumper car. The ride starts, there are a BUNCH OF COLLEGE KIDS showing off to their GIRLFRIENDS. One of them - A JOCK - starts picking on Lucas, banging him hard.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: But his shout can’t be heard over the LOUD ROCK MUSIC. The Jock lines up behind Lucas, times it to sandwich him and really hits him hard. Lucas head shoots forward, almost hits the wheel. Dwight runs out onto the metal floor, stands on the back of Lucas’ car.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, knock it off. The ride stops.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: Get off the floor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Come on Lou, lets go.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: If your kid’s chicken get him outta here. Dwight throws him a look, then leads Lou away. The jock makes chicken noises. Lou looks to Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight leads Lucas through the exit tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You could have kicked his ass.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could have. We’d have gotten thrown out. Or worse. Your Mom would have been mad at me, and we’d have missed the Series together.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I’m glad we got out of there. (a beat) How long you got to go away for?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. INT. LEARNER HOUSE. ETHAN’S STUDY - NIGHT Ethan locks the door, goes to his desk, takes out the photo, breaks the frame, places the photo on the desk, takes a digital photo. ON MONITOR: The photo is now in the computer. Ethan is enlarging it, focusing on the grill guard.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK AND FORTH BETWEEN
dialogues.text: ETHAN’S FACE AND A RAPID CUTS OF A SERIES OF WEB PAGES: on guns - shot guns - catalogues. A mix of the boring - supermarket catalogues - with the crazy - Soldier of Fortune - info on sawed off shotguns - revenge photos. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now Ethan is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I saw your ad on the web. I’m looking for a pistol, something simple, a revolver maybe. He hangs up, then the sound of the door handle. The knocking.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ethan!

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. He sticks the photo in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why’s this door locked? Ethan opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, maybe something’s up with the lock.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Will you be joining us for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I’m not hungry. She walks away. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE - NIGHT 148 The first night of the Series. Red Sox vs. Cardinals. Chips, soda, hot dogs spread out on a table. Dwight and Lucas are totally absorbed in the game. INT. ETHAN’S CAR, LOCAL HUNTING STORE - NIGHT 150 Ethan sits outside the hunting store, he’s nervous as he fumbles with a revolver. It falls apart in his hands. A car pulls up beside him, he hastily packs the pieces in the box, takes off.  153 155 157 158 159 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 pm Fall night, leaves blow around the garden. A few lights on, the house looks peaceful INT. DWIGHT’S LIVING ROOM. NIGHT The world series game has just started. Lucas is almost exploding with excitement. Dwight is beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan stands alone outside Emma’s room, thoughts and feelings barely in control. He takes a deep breath before entering. INT. LEARNER HOUSE. EMMA’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 159 Emma’s in her pajamas, under the covers. Ethan sits down on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Sleepy?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Well, try. Close your eyes. Her eyes remain open, looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Will you tell me a good night story?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Not tonight. Ethan places his hands over Emma’s hands. He looks on the verge of tears. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Dad, your hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I must be tired.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Time for bed. Ethan tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Good night, Pumpkin. Don’t ever forget how much I love you.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: I love you too, Dad. She closes her eyes. He kisses her and gets up and turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves Emma’s door open a few inches. Grace stands in the hallway, dressed in her nightgown. She stares at him, a look wavering between forgiveness and rejection. He stares back, is about to offer an excuse.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Io... She disappears inside their bedroom and closes the door. 161 INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE - SAME TIME 161 The final moments of the game. A cliff hanger. The Sox take it. Lucas is ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Oh my God, dad, I can’t wait for tomorrow, you think they can do it, do you?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I told you this is their year.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hey dad, do you think mom would let me live here with you for a while? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: WIGHT
dialogues.text: We’ve got to work on that one, come hit the sack buddy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Night dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan walks from his house to his car.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 163
dialogues.text: INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 164 Dwight cracks open a beer, collapses onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 166
dialogues.text: EXT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE - NIGHT 167 Ethan’s car appears a short distance from Dwight’s house, the lights go off, the engine shuts down and the car coasts in neutral to a spot on the street outside Dwights INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 168 Dwight’s has dosed off on the couch. The doorbell rings. Dwight’s eyes wide open now - anxious. He goes to the window, pulls aside the blind a little, And sees Ethan. He’s pulls back from the window - panic. Then he makes the decision - goes to the door. The door opens. Dwight appears.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Mr. Arno. Ethan holds up the photo of Dwight and Lucas. Ethan sticks the barrel of his revolver in Dwight’s face and pushes him back into the house.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight backs into the house, across the floor, knocks a stool over. Lucas voice from his bedroom, breaks through.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad! Ethan spins around, the revolver is pointed toward the sound. Dwight puts his body between Ethan and the corridor to Lucas bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: It’s alright Lou, I knocked over a stool.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (confused, angry) Is that your son? Dwight is backing up, keeping his body between Ethan and Lucas room.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shut him up. Dwight backs up to the door to Ethan’s room. His hands up appealing for Ethan to stay out. Dwight opens the door to Lucas bedroom. Ethan flattens himself against the wall beside the door, points the shotgun, hears Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who’s there dad. Dwight stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: No one, I banged a stool and the tvs too loud, come on go asleep. Ethan has the shotgun leveled at his head. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I need to pee. Dwight’s look says “Oh Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Ah Lou, you’ll ruin your sleep. Ethan’s moves out so that he keep the shotgun trained on Dwight. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Hurry up. Dwight is dying inside. Ethan briskles with nervous adrenalin. An eternity. The sound of the toilet flushing, the toilet door opening.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get in to bed. You gotta catch up on your sleep.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Okay dad, love you.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I love you too, goodnight. Dwight closes the door, turns to Ethan who is backing away along the corridor toward the living room. He looks panicked, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Come on. EXT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. NIGHT The door opens, Dwight emerges, the gun is in his back. Ethan appears. Dwight stands in the garden. Ethan looks around, unsure, grabs Dwight by the coat and pushes him toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Hurry up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They get to the car, Ethan looks confused, this is uncharted territory.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go to the trunk. Dwight heads for the trunk. Close on the trunk pops open.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get in. Dwight clambers in. Ethan pushes the trunk down. To black He snaps the trunk closed. BANG

dialogues.speaker: TO BLACK
dialogues.text: The bang of the trunk turns into the CRACK of a baseball bat hitting a ball

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC overwhelmed by the growing ROAR of 30,000 fans. It’s not just another baseball game - it’s the Red Sox- vs. Yankees. Fenway’s a madhouse.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: The scoreboard shows the game tied 4-4 in the bottom of the 9th. CLOSE IN on a DWIGHT and LUCAS in box seats on the third base line. LUCAS has his chin just above the railing and his hands clenched into fists, YELLING himself hoarse.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Come on, Pedro! Strike him out! Strike him out! Pedro Martinez winds up and throws a blazing fastball right past a flailing Bernie Williams. The crowd erupts. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah! Dad, didya see that? Didya, Dad? Lucas and Dwight jump as one, ROAR, high five, the pure joy of a moment shared between father and son. As they settle into their seats, Dwight hears the faint ring of a cell phone over the cheers.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: What’s that? He looks toward Lucas pocket.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: It’s your phone, answer it please. Lucas retrieves the phone like it’s Kryptonite, checks who it is, a look of resignation to Dwight, then he answers.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hey mom ... no, we’re still at the game ... but its not over. No, no, its nearly over. Lucas listens, then hands the phone to Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah I know what the curfew time is. 1’11 have him back ... I said I’1l have him back. He hands the phone back to Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: We can’t leave dad. Please? Dwight jumps to his feet CHEERING, problems forgotten. He picks up his laughing, yelling son, hugs him ina raucous dance. INT. DWIGHT’S CAR - DUSK 173 The car park exit is JAMMED WITH CARS, HORNS SOUND in frustration. Dwight whispers a curse as he jockeys for position to get out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lucas slips his phone from his pocket and checks, the screen reads 6 missed calls.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Is that your mom again?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No, I was checking the time. You wanna hear a joke?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: A doctor at a mental hospital decides to take his patients to a Red Sox game, but he says you have to do what I say. When they get to their seats he says, “sit nuts.” They all sit. When the Red Sox score he says, “cheer nuts.” They all cheer. The Yankees score he says, “boo nuts.” They all boo. Then, a guy with a tray comes down the aisle shouting “pea nuts!” Dwight loves it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I change the station?

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Sure. Lucas seat belt won’t let him reach. He unbuckles, reaches the radio and tunes in the sports station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark now. A country parkway (The Hutchinson). Dwight’s Ford Explorer guns along at 80. The passenger side headlight is not working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gloom of the car, Dwight takes a drag on a cigarette, rolls down his window and blows the smoke out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He checks on Lucas: who is asleep, with his cheek pressed up against the door. He checks the dashboard clock: 8:40.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Fuck. Then: up ahead, in the lone beam of light, we see a SIGN for the next exit - RESERVATION ROAD (a short cut). At the last minute, Dwight decides to take the exit. Tires SQUEAL lightly. He checks on Lucas again: still sleeping. He hits the radio button to the progressive rock station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road, narrow and dark, running through woods. Dwight gives the car more gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight’s car with the single headlight SPEEDS through the darkness. The orange tip of his cigarette GLOWS behind the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight’s faintly sweaty face silhouetted behind the orange tip of his lit cigarette. He checks the dashboard clock again: 8:55 He gives the car more gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he rounds the corner, Dwight’s face is illuminated by the white light of the brights from a car coming in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dwight’s POV a blaze of light, the faint glow of an old gas station off to his left, then something moving on the grass verge. A boy's face, frozen in horror! Dwight, jams on the brakes hard, hurls Lucas into the dash. BANG - the boy flies off to the side, as Lucas’ face smashes into the dash.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Dwight reaches across to Lucas who is doubled up in pain, clutching his eye.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you alright?! Then Dwight looks in the mirror, sees a man (Ethan) standing in the road, staring, but Lucas is crying now.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dad, dad, my eye!

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It hurts. Please dad. Dwight looks in the mirror again, then puts his foot on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan appears confused, not sure where to go. The car’s headlights push through the darkness revealing, rocks, trees, and beyond the moon glistening off the waters of Long Island Sound where josh’s ashes were scattered.  181 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trunk pops open. Dwight is disoriented doesn’t know what to do, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Get out! Dwight still doesn’t move. Ethan lifts the barrel of the gun, brings it down on Dwight’s head, BANG, the revolver accidentally discharges.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT ETHAN
dialogues.text: AaaHH! Aaahh! Ethan jumps back in shock, stands motionless as the gunshot rings across the Sound. Ethan doesn’t know what to do. He looks at Dwight breathing heavily inside the trunk. Still silence. Close on Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get out! Dwight clambers out.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Over there! Dwight heads toward the sandy shore. Ethan looks like he’s going to explode. He rushes toward Dwight with the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know what you have done to my family. You have destroyed us!

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Turn me in to the police. I’1l go to jail He is close enough to kick him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: You want me to turn you in so that you can pull your tricks in court, and then laugh at me on the street. You sat and lied to me. We'll get this guy, compensation. I gave you his accident report, with those photos, his dead body. You're a fucking murderer.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Please, believe me. It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (screams) An accident, you fucking killed him, and you drove away, why would you drive away from an accident.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: I didnt know you son was dead, I

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: He was road kill, a dead squirrel, stray dog, my Josh. Did he see you.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Please, I see him every night ... his face. Please

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Did you see the fireflies .... He as releasing fireflies. He wouldn’t hurt fly... Fuck you, fuck you to hell. You sat and listened to me, shook my hand. You said you were going to help me. What sort of a monster are you? Have you no soul? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: All I wanted was a few days with my son before he hates me .... I needed time.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Time! What time. Time to torment me, to shout Lou in my face. You went with me to the place where you killed my son and you stood their with your stupid face and said there would be a break in the case. You don’t deserve to live. He pushes Dwight toward the water ... Dwight is destroyed by Ethan’s rage and hate.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Don’t do this, not for me, for you, don’t ruin your life like I did ....

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, you’re pathetic, you'll say anything, to save yourself. As they move so seaweed covered rocks, Ethan slips, he reaches, tries to grab on to Dwight’s sweater. Misses. Crashes on to the rocks, Bangs his head, The revolver flies from his hand. And falls to the ground. He’s stunned, can’t move. Then turns to see Dwight lift the revolver. The cylinder has fallen open. Now Dwight Snaps it back into place. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And points the gun at Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: DWIGHT
dialogues.text: Get up. Ethan stands, Dwight holds the gun on him. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Get back. I’m not going to let you be a murderer. You can’t do this. COCKS the hammer. And HOLDS it to his head. DWIGHT (CONT’D) No. No. I have to die to get this over. I have to end this. You need me dead? Blood for blood. Nothing else will do. Ethan, stares at him. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Nothing else to do. Ethan stares. SILENCE Dwight’s hand tightens on the trigger. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Oh jesus, oh jesus. I took your boy's life,. If this is what it takes to give you back your life I’ll do it. Tell me to do it. Dwight’s hand trembles as he presses the gun to his head. DWIGHT (CONT’D) COME ON, tell me, Please. This is easier. Ethan stares at him, tries to find the words, can’t he’s frozen between anger and pity. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Tell me, tell me, I’1l do it, say it. Please. Ethan can only stare. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DWIGHT (CONT’D) Please. Ethan turns, And walks away. Dwight calls out after him. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Don’t leave me here. Please don’t leave me. Dwight falls to his knees, weeping uncontrollably. DWIGHT (CONT’D) Please forgive me! Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethan sits alone on the top stair of the porch as the faintest light of dawn breaks.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SEASHORE. DAWN
dialogues.text: The grey of pre dawn, Dwight is still sitting on a rock, staring out at the faint glow of the sun. EXT. LEARNER HOUSE. BACK PORCH.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Ethan’s still there, weeping with grief, exhaustion. The dog barks, a light comes on, Grace emerges. He looks round at her, puts his hand out, she takes it, sits beside him, he puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: (crying) God, I miss him so. She rests her head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Come into the house. She helps him up, leads him inside.  184 111. INT. DWIGHT’S HOUSE. NIGHT 184 It’s the last pitch of the Series. Cardinals Vs Sox. The Red Sox Keith Foulke pitches. Edgar Renteria of the Cardinals grounds out! And it’s over! Total jubilation among the Sox. Lucas jumps up on the couch, squeals with delight, grabs his dad, and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: They won Dad. They won! Dwight hugs Lucas close. Track back to the video camera alone on the video camera, on the breakfast bar.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LUCAS ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Lucas sits on the bed, facing the wall, only his back is visible. Over his shoulder, he’s looking at the video camera. It’s Dwight’s confession to him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: It’s cold December day. Ethan and Grace walk hand in hand along the beach. A couple again.
